alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Henry; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 11:51AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Whiteside, southeastern Henry and Bureau Counties through 1230 PM CST... At 1151 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Osceola, or near Kewanee, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Sheffield around 1200 PM CST. Buda around 1205 PM CST. Wyanet around 1210 PM CST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Princeton and Walnut. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 30 and 58. Interstate 88 between mile markers 43 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
